Job Title: Supply Chain Manager

Location: Raynham, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing, Supply Chain

Description:
The main objective of the Supply Chain Manager is to lead and manage the Supply Chain Team while ensuring the effective process management of all implants, instruments, and robotics manufactured and distributed by Corin USA. This includes the strategy and procurement of inventory to maintain an effective inventory holding. Responsible for driving supply and inventory continuous improvement processes and tools for balancing financials and service to customers. All aspects of the role must be compliant with company policy and procedures and the requirements of ISO9001
The role is based in our Raynham US headquarters.
The ideal Supply Chain Manager (US) will have a A roll-up-your-sleeves approach with a "can do" accountable attitudeBe comfortable challenging the status quo and driving new ideas and processes forward#Bachelor’s degree in a related field of discipline.Minimum 5+ years of previous Supply Chain managerial / team-leading experience in a corporate environment.Experienced in ERP systems management and other supply chain management applications.APICS / ISM / SCPro certification preferred.Strong interpersonal and communication skills with an ability to develop and maintain effective relationships.Ability to prioritize actions in a fast-paced environment.Proven ability to plan, direct, and maintain long and short-term goals.Analytical, data-focused mindset coupled with process improvement implementation.Logical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.Ability to work under pressure, calmly, and professionally.
The key responsibilities of the Supply Chain Manager (US) are. Supply of Components and Finished Goods:Monitor the supply of implants, instruments, and robotics; finished goods, and components, in support of the demand plan.Establish and maintain effective inventory levels to minimize backorders and improve inventory turns.Prepare and participate in weekly supply meetings with Global Supply Chain to ensure consistent supply.Communicate the status of supply to the Commercial team, identifying risks and expected recovery timelines.Manage suppliers, collaborating with Quality and Distribution.Establish monthly build plans to meet the demand plan for Manufacturing to execute within their capacity. Communicate delta in supply and capacity.Support the service plan of spare parts for Robotics and Instruments.Support the supply chain of NPI and obsolescence projects.Support the supply chain requirements of Field Operations.Inventory Management:Strategy and procurement of inventory to maintain an effective inventory holding.Support Global SIOP on inventory strategies to optimize cash flow and reduce reoccurring customer backorders.Oversee the supplier returns process, RTV transactions, and credits for non-conforming materials.Manage the inventory turns within the US facility.Team Development:Lead and manage all personnel within the Supply Chain Team including recruitment, onboarding, ongoing performance management, training, and development of staff.Oversee and assess output and the quality of service we provide to the supply chain team.Strategize and monitor the daily activities of the Supply Chain Team.Instil a service-first culture within the department and the larger operation.Develop an effective cross-training program to ensure task coverage at all times.Develop, implement, and monitor Supply Chain procedures to ensure compliance with all regulatory agency requirements.Instigate root cause investigations and corrective action for the department.·Assist with budget preparation for the Supply Chain department.Monitoring & Controls:Leverage the efficient usage of the ERP system within the department.Implement effective KPIs to monitor the health of the Supply Chain department, identifying leading and lagging indicators of control to proactively influence the supply health of the business.
All aspects of the role must be compliant with company policy and procedures and the requirements of ISO9001.
Corin provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Prepare and participate in weekly supply meetings with Global Supply Chain to ensure consistent supply.
Communicate the status of supply to the Commercial team, identifying risks and expected recovery timelines.
Manage suppliers, collaborating with Quality and Distribution.
Establish monthly build plans to meet the demand plan for Manufacturing to execute within their capacity.
Communicate delta in supply and capacity.
Support the service plan of spare parts for Robotics and Instruments.
Support the supply chain of NPI and obsolescence projects.
Support the supply chain requirements of Field Operations.
Inventory Management: Strategy and procurement of inventory to maintain an effective inventory holding.
Support Global SIOP on inventory strategies to optimize cash flow and reduce reoccurring customer backorders.
Oversee the supplier returns process, RTV transactions, and credits for non-conforming materials.
Manage the inventory turns within the US facility.
Lead and manage all personnel within the Supply Chain Team including recruitment, onboarding, ongoing performance management, training, and development of staff.
Oversee and assess output and the quality of service provided to the supply chain team.
Strategize and monitor the daily activities of the Supply Chain Team.
Instil a service-first culture within the department and the larger operation.
Develop an effective cross-training program to ensure task coverage at all times.
Develop, implement, and monitor Supply Chain procedures to ensure compliance with all regulatory agency requirements.
Assist with budget preparation for the Supply Chain department.
Monitoring & Controls: Leverage the efficient usage of the ERP system within the department.
Implement effective KPIs to monitor the health of the Supply Chain department, identifying leading and lagging indicators of control to proactively influence the supply health of the business.
